intro: Triodanis texana, commonly known as the Texas false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Triodanis texana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
